item.description:
A boardgame version of "I Spy". One player secretly selects a card which represents one of the characters pictured on the game board.

One by one the remaining players must try to guess the first player's secret character. Players may only ask questions which may be answered "yes" or "no". Each question or incorrect guess at the secret costs a player one of his ten chips.

The player who correctly guesses the secret identity collects the card from the first player. The role of first player now passes to the next player to the left.

Once everyone has had a chance to be first player the game ends. The game can also be played two or more rounds, depending on how long a game is desired. The winner is the person who has the most cards.

Nopea Veto

-Reaction game for the whole family
-3-7 players
-Ages 4 and up

Similar to:

 Catch me!
 3 Blind Mice
 Carla Cat

name.value: Magic Tent Game with Mystery Treasure Hunt

item.description: It's a story, a game, and an adventure! Hank, Stella and Cody were camping one night in their grandfather's mysterious tent. When they woke up the next morning, they were in another part of the world! Can you solve the mystery of the Magic Tent and bring them home? Young adventurers climb into the full-size, indoor play tent and begin reading the story. The story contains hints to finding clues that parents have hidden around the house. The mystery and clues are provided in the Mystery Treasure Hunt, Vol. 1 Alaska, which is included with this set. After reading each hint, the kids climb out of the tent and race to find the hidden clue. When they have collected all the clues, they'll fit them together to reveal a secret message. It's an active and imaginative game for groups or individuals. The high-quality tent makes a colorful, sturdy play structure. It stands nearly 5 feet tall and 4 feet across, with stay-open tabs and mesh ventilation panels. Made from sturdy, flame-retardant, 70 denier nylon. Comes with 48" x 58" Nylon Tent, 15 Tent Poles, Mystery Treasure Hunt and Illustrated Instructions. For 1 or More Players, Ages 7 and up.

link.value: The Magic Tent Expansion Pack: Mystery Treasure Hunt Vol. 2 – Australia

item.description:
The aim of Crazy Cups is to stack the Crazy Cups in stacks of varying heights and then take the stacks back down such that the cups are stacked neatly back into each other.

It is essentially a game of dexterity and you are aiming to beat either your best time to do a particular routine or the time that was set by the other people playing it with you.

Similar to:

 Kup Stax

item.description:
Fields of Honor - an Historical Simulation of Warfare in the 19th Century" is a set of miniatures rules for recreating the wars from 1843 to 1902 in five different unit scales from section to brigade.

The 120-page book contains army lists and weapon data for 21 different wars, including the Crimean War, Mexican-American War, Americal Civil War, Franco-Prussian War, most British colonial wars and the Boxer Rebellion. Five scenarios are also included: Alma, Isandhlwana, Gravelotte-St. Privat, Khartoum and Little Big Horn.

The rules later inspired two sequels - FoH: the American War for Independence and FoH: WWII.

This is a party game intended for adult couples. The object is for couples to score points by matching their answers to questions in six different categories (Sex, General issues, Entertainment, Children, Work , and Domestic Issues). The winners are the first couple to accumulate at least 100 points, including at least 10 in each category.

Jim Prentice Electric Basketball from 1949. Each player has three terminal buttons. Players each select one or two buttons to push during a play. The combination of both players choosing one or two buttons results in a play or a shot depending on where on the court the play started from.

name.value: The Make My Day Card Game

item.description: This is a card game with a political satire theme. Players take the role of world leaders and compete for power by accumulating positive public relations (PR) points for themselves and damaging the PR scores of other players. Game contents include rules, score pad, marking pen and 216 cards.

Johnny Reb is a set of miniatures rules from the American Civil War. Units are regiments of 15 to 30 figures divided into 5 bases, with players commanding a division or corps.

The first edition was published by Adventure Games in 1983. GDW released a 2nd edition with minor changes in 1988, with a scenario book "To the Sound of the Guns" the same year. Johnny Reb III, published by John Hill in 1996 is a very different game, with major changes to the scale (1":50 vs 1":40 yards, 1:30 vs 1:20 men, artillery batteries vs sections) and games mechanisms.

item.description:
Probably made during World War II since the cardboard is very flimsy, prints aren't centered and some cards have both straight angled and rounded corners.

This must be a Belgian version with text in both Flemish and
French languages. The spelling is quite old.

Goal of the game is to collect and play cards to drop a certain amount of bombs on the enemy. As an opponent cards can be played to harass and slow down the other player (pilot dead, bad weather,...)

The advanced version of Taliesin Starter Game, Taliesin Master Game is played on 3 circular boards, one on top of the other. There are nine different types of player piece, in gold or silver, each with unique movement. The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Life Force piece.

The core of the 3 boards is a "black hole" and this is the means of transferring pieces between boards.

Taliesin (Starter Game) is played on a round board with 19 pieces on each side and is very similar to chess, with soldiers moving one space, centurions moving like rooks, Taliesin moving in all directions and capturing the opponent's Life Force being the object of the game. There are nine different types of piece, but several move in the same way as others; White Goddess and Shogun are essentially the same pieces, as are King Arthur, Henge and Centurion.

There is also Taliesin Master Game, which has 3 boards with additional rules.

A basic roll & move trivia game about nature and the environment.
Players gain Families cards by answering right to the questions, they loose a card.
The game ends when a player has 5 of the 7 different Families cards.

item.description: First player to fill all the shapes on their ship wins. The spinner indicates the piece (circle, triangle, or square) a player may place.

item.description:
From Games of Art, Mondrian is a game based on the artwork of Piet Mondrian known for his paintings of rectangles of color.

The object of the game is to complete rectangular areas with color, scoring points for the number of sections within the rectangle. Players are prevented from coloring in adjacent sections with the same color.

From the instructions:
Player #1 represents the investigators who have witnessed strange murders on the Miskatonic University Campus and now seek to find and destroy the cause of these murders before greater evil befalls Arkham. The evil is the spawn in human form, Wilbur Whately [sic]. To win, the investigator player must find and destroy him before or after he transforms into the spawn.
Player #2 represents the spawn and the cultists that worship and protect him. This player must eliminate all professor, police, reporter, and detective counters from play. At any point that he achieves this goal, player #2 wins the game. In the process of this, player #2 attempts to have Wilbur kill enough people to gain the energy he needs to transform into the spawn. Once Wilbur is the spawn, it will be much easier for him to attack and win.
Wilbur must transform into the spawn by the end of the last full moon phase on the turn track or his opportunity will pass until next year. Should he fail to transform into the spawn by the end of this phase, the game ends in a stalemate.

A tile laying game where you are building a maze and trying to move your pawn to an exit while trapping everyone else. There are several types of tiles (e.g., thugs who you can fight to take cards from your opponents; medics who can heal you; mole people, who help move you around to different parts of the maze; etc.) that make up the maze. There is also an action deck that can move you or your opponents around the maze, or reconfigure the maze. The first person out of the maze wins!

Another Electric game from Jim Prentice. This one is called JIM PRENTICE Electric Fire Fighters. I have little information about the game except that by pushing a trigger device you respond to the call for help fighting a fire.

This is a fairly basic spin and move game where players compete to be the first to complete an airplane race around the world. The large square metal board is a world map with a racing course plotted on it. The board has 2 spinners on it, which players use to control their airplane movement. Various other spaces/map coordinates have other bonus and hazard effects on the race.

This game is very similar to "Operation," in that it is a physical dexterity game where the players play the role of a surgeon operating on a cartoon-like character. In this version, players use a fork like tool to carefully remove various pieces of the patient without causing him to shake and wake up.

Franklin, Bear, Fox, and Snail are on their way home from school, and the teacher has given each an exciting challenge: Try to fill score cards with things they have found on the way home!

Players search for the treasure chips that match their score card. The winner is the player who is the first to find all the chips in his set. Versions are included for beginning and advanced players. No reading required.

Franklin’s Treasure Hunt Game is intended to help players to develop skills of visual discrimination, sorting and classifying, as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing, and respecting others.

item.description:
Paartie - Plauderspiel für Partner is a cardgame for adults. Players use cards to try and gain gems. You win gems by knowing what your partner thinks, feels, wants. A game for relationships.

Ages 18 and up. Released: Essen 2007.

The Game of Football produced by Parker Brothers in 1880 features a picture of young boys playing a game that looks a bit like sandlot football. The game comes with a number of colored pieces that represent players and by jumping over players each team tries to score goals.

As a version of late-1800s football, this game would be completely different from the same-named Game of Football from 1948, as the rules of the physical game developed significantly in the intervening 70 years.

Players race against the clock to copy building plans of various difficulties, each one revealed in turn from a deck of cards. Each completed card is worth a number of points, with harder builds being worth more points. If you spot an error in an opponent's build, call it, and they lose those points. After three rounds, the player with the most points is the champion builder.

Features 10 new and different shapes from the original Make 'N' Break, leading to new and more challenging tasks to complete.

item.description:
Das Lieblingsspiel Von Adam Riese (the Favorite Game of Adam Riese) is a simple self-published wooden abstract arithmetic game for two that plays in 5 to 10 minutes, and that comes in a pouch.

Each player (light and dark) plays on the same off-set grid of three rows up and three rows down. Each row has a start value of ten and four spaces to fill, except one space marked (+), resulting in fourteen spaces in all to fill. Each player has 10 stones to place: four square value stones (4, 3, 2, and 1), three round arithmetic symbol stones (the minus sign, the division sign, and the multiplication sign), and 3 tall round scoring markers (two in their own colour and one in their opponent's). Players take turns to place one stone of their own choice from their own supply onto the appropriate spaces. After all stones are placed, the scores are determined. Each player scores all the rows that are marked by the tall scoring stones of their color (one of which is placed by the opponent), and the score for each row is the outcome of the simple formula that players have created with the stones. Whoever gets the most points overall is the winner.

Adam Riese, in the title, refers to the great German mathematician Adam Ries, better known as Adam Riese (1492-1559), whose work contributed to the phasing out of the impractical Roman numerals in favour of the Arabic numerals that we currently use, and who made it his life's ambition to bring the basics of mathematics and algebra to all people. For that reason, he wrote his science books in German, rather than in Latin, the language of the scientific elite, and was one of the first to do so. The German phrase "nach Adam Riese" (according to Adam Riese) is still used as an expression in the German language to emphasize the obvious correctness of a result of simple arithmetic.

"An enlightening and non-competitive game for Christians from different backgrounds to explore and share their beliefs" (From box cover).

Players move their pieces, answer questions and vote on Christian discussion topics to gain game segments. Game continues until all have 6 segments; there are no winners or losers.

Published on behalf of the Churches in Great Britain and Ireland.

name.value: Du bist der Größte, kleiner Rabe

item.description:
You are the Biggest, Little Raven! All the forest friends of little Raven race from all edges of the forest to little Raven's nest in the meadow. Each team has three animals and little Raven is the judge. The first team member to reach the center gets a piece of the cake from little Raven in its nest. Naturally he or she takes the largest piece. And once the pieces are distributed, little Raven determines which crew won.
An exciting game for color learning.
Contents: game board, 12 play figures, 1 little Raven, 1 Raven nest, 8 pieces of cake of different sizes, 2 color cubes, and rules.
Ages 4 and up.
The winner becomes the Postmaster by returning to the Post Office after delivering all their mail. Plan mail routes which can be altered by draw cards.

The Bomb is Ticking!: Your knowledge can save the city.
A self-published game created by Burkhardt and the senior class of Schubart-Realschule, Geislingen an der Steige, Germany. It centers abound the city of Geislingen as threatened by a bomb. Players need to know the answers to general and city-specific questions. With each wrong answer a figure advances forward to detonate the bomb. Conversely, if three questions are answered correctly, the players receive one of six puzzle pieces. When completed, the pieces combine to make a pair of scissors that can cut the fuse in time and thus save all the players and their city. This game may be the genesis of Burkhardt's DEUTSCHLAND - Finden Sie Minden (the map game for 3-5 players published by Kosmos).

A game as varied as one day at the beach. The sun shines, the sunscreen disappears, and the boombox blares. Appears to be a companion game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the FRECHE MÄDCHEN FRECHE BÜCHER or IMPUDENT GIRLS IMPUDENT BOOKS.
Designer's site says it is for girls Ages 10 - 14.
http://www.burkhardt-spiele.de/Meine%20Ludographie.2.htm

The earliest recorded hunt game in Europe, Catch the Hare was mentioned in Libro de los Juegos (Book of Games) commissioned by Alfonso X in 1283. It is played on an alquerque board, with one side taking the part of a hare and the other taking 12 hunters. The hunters must trap the hare so that it cannot move; the hare must kill enough hunters to make their task impossible.

item.description: Billed as "The True American Teen Game" and "The Game That All Girls Love to Play," this was a game marketed for teenage (or preteen girls). The game is a competition between players to achieve the highest level of "popularity." The game had an interesting mechanism for determining whether a girls scored popularity--a small plastic pink phone (the "automatic answer phone").

A children's memory game with a theme based on the children's picture book by Janelle Cannon. Stellaluna loves her baby bird friends, but hates those icky bugs they have to eat in Mother Bird's nest! She needs to find her own bat family again and feast on yummy mangoes. Help Stellaluna learn the skills she needs to be a bat again.

Players take turns turning over memory chips. If it is a helper chip, they place it the sky path and move Stellaluna one space forward. If it is not, they turn it back over again and leave it in place. When Stellaluna reaches home, all players win! There is a more advanced ruleset for older players.

This game is intended to teach young players to develop memory and story-telling skills as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing and respecting others.

The zoo animals are jostling to get inside the holiday express. But not all the animals will fit! Already the first ones tumble off the wagon! Who with a bit of skill will get their animals inside the train? A pushing game for 2 to 4 skillful players.

name.value: Die Wilden Hühner und die Liebe

item.description: Game tie-in to the German 2007 film of the same name based on the book by the writer of "Inkheart", Cornelia Funke. The title translates as "Wild Chickens and Love." The description at Amazon.de makes it sound like a romantic polygon of Sprotte, Melanie, Frieda, Wilma, Trude, and Maik. The players try to collect the correct pairs. Contents: 5 collecting maps, 35 cards, 4 three wooden meeples, and 49 wild chicken markers. For Ages 8 - 13.

Players take turns being either Finger Dinger Man or Super Slow Man.Depending on the card drawn, Finger Dinger Man is released down a ramp towards Super Slow Man. Buttons are pushed to fake out your opponent by both players. The winner gets a card. Object:To win the most Finger Dinger Man cards.

Not to be confused with the Lingo games which are played with pegs, cards or scrabble-like tiles.

The 25 letter dice are placed at random into the spaces of the grid. The 12 scoring pegs are placed in the holes in the corners.

Players then take turns to think of words beginning with the letters showing on the tops of the dice in the grid & each time a player names an acceptable word they remove the appropriate die from the grid & keep it (for scoring at the end of the game).

The winner is the player with the highest number of points !

name.value: The Game of Categories, Answers and Fun

item.description: The object of the game is to fill in the spaces of the game sheet with answers that start with a designated letter and are associated with a specific category within the allotted time. This is very much like the game Scattergories that came a year before it.
A children's game (Ages 4 - 8) in which players must match tiles of objects whose words sound very similar (in German).

item.description: A cardgame where players use collections of cards to attack and defend, themed around castle sieges. The first player to successfully attack three times wins. Designed for a 2002 competition to create a game based on siege attacks.

The Transformers Card Game consists of four games using a 36-card deck containing 18 Autobots and 18 Decepticons. The following are the four games that can be played and a brief summaryof each:

1.)The Transformers Truth Game: The object is to get rid of all your card by placing two, three or four cards on the table and declaring that they are all the same numbered card. If any opponent thinks you are bluffing then he declares this. The player than shows the cards. If the player lied than he takes all the cards. However, if he was telling the truth then the opponent takes all the cards.

2.)Robot Battle: This game is played like the game "War" where you want to be the one with all the cards at the end.

3.)The Transformers Brainpower: This is a matching game where all cards are placed face down on the table and then two cards are flipped. If they are the same, then the player takes the pair and goes again. However, if the cards are different then the players turn is over. The player with the greatest number of pairs wins.

4.)The Transformers Shout: In this game, each player flips over cards one at a time. When a card is duplicated, the first person to spot this and yell "transformers" gets all the cards on then table. This continues until one player has no cards. At that time, the player with the most cards is the winner.

How well do you know your US History?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the place, event or person in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

How well can you identify wild animals?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the animal in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name.value: Helmsman: The Game of Table Top Sailing

item.description: Helmsman The Game of Table Top Sailing Made in England by Minimodels LTD. The object of this game is for two or more players to complete the sailing course on the board by fair sailing and superior skill thereby beating your opponents.

Beat the Bookie published by Chad Valley/Barclay Toys from London in 1965. Game features a four foot long mechanical track, a game betting board and 5 metal "horses". Turning a crank on the game board moves the horses down the track and eventually produces a winning horse.

This 1980 game from Real Life Games from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma is really just a football gambling game. You use real life football games and then bet on which team will win and cover the spread. You are playing with play money. The game tells you to add up your total wins and loses and then either laugh or cry. Game comes with a supply of play money and a weekly score sheet to mark down how you are doing.

A children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move around the board collecting cards representing the cycle of nature (the seasons). In the process they learn the days of the week and months of the year. A dexterity element occurs when one player must drop the four-seasons card and another player must quickly catch it.

name.value: Mickey Mantle: Roger Maris Official Home Run Derby Game

item.description: The baseball game is played by throwing Styrofoam balls at prongs contained within the target areas. Object was to have balls stick to the board in the HOME RUN area. The game comes with 3 Styrofoam balls and a small instruction sheet.

Appears to be a companion card game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the Sassy Girls, Sassy Books series. http://www.frechemaedchen.de/
The “Song for Tom” is set in the world of showbiz and music competitions. The players all have a crush on bitter-sweet Tom. Each player tries to form "girl groups" to win the contest first with a foursome, then a trio, and finally as a duo of musician cards. The first to complete a group receives a lucky stone as a reward. It takes three stones to win but heart-breaker Tom can appear at anytime to change the line-up.

name.value: Official Mickey Mantle Baseball Action Game

item.description: From Key Man; The box depicts a great picture of Mickey Mantle ready to swing the bat. The plastic toy is Approximately 7" long. Batter swings, and hits ball off standing tee when plunger is pushed.

Win-A-Card Board Game was put out by Milton Bradley in 1969 and came with 1968 Topps Baseball cards. Football and Non Sports cards were also included. The cards came in clear cellophane packs. The game box reads "Contains a generous supply.", probably between 50-70 baseball cards, and various amount of the other sports, and non sports cards. The 1968 Topps cards that were included with the game are of a different variation to the regular issued Topps cards. The backs of the cards are a bright yellow color as opposed to orange backs. Game included a spinner which was used to determine if trades of cards between players took place.

Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move their fantasy character (fairy, dwarf, giant or wizard) through the Charm Forest looking for treasures. Each treasure is of a particular quantity (4 stars, 6 jewels, etc.). The player must correctly reveal the right number treasure in order to advance towards the castle. The first player to reach the castle wins.

item.description: "Syllable King Castle" is a children's game (Ages 5 - 8) in which players must speak one-word answers to simple questions in order to get past doors on the game board. In addition to knowing the right answer, players must also indicate the syllables in the answer word by knocking on a door with a wooden stick. The first player to reach the top of the castle wins.

This is from the "Little Raven" game series based on the children's book series by author Nele Moost and illustrator Annet Rudolph. Alles Meins! is a children's game (Ages 4 - 12) in which players must keep track of the locations of different animals as they move around the game board in order to win tokens. It features "Small Raven": a popular character in German children's literature.

The little crow steals whatever toy is in front of him, but when he has taken all the toys from his friends, he realizes that this is not nice and gives all the toys back. This is a move and collect game.

Not to be confused with The Spiders Web from Otero Games.

Guide the spider around his web by tilting the board to control his scurrying movements. But beware ! If the spider passes over a hole he may stop in his tracks.

A tantalizing game teaching dexterity & co-ordination for any number of players from six years up !
Players spin a spinner to move their ship around a series of islands, racing to be the first to reach the home base.

The game box shows a long Zeppelin air ship named ZZ1 and has the subtitle "Air Game". The two part board shows three cities inside large circles, Berlin, Paris and New York from left to right. Connecting the cities are curved, color paths, demarcated into spaces by crossing lines. The zeppelin pieces are made of metal. There are also cards showing zeppelins. The game was made to tie-in with the then new Transatlantic dirigible service

Based on a German television series of the same name around the time. Players were travelers parachuting into various adventurous locales such as making an accuracy jump, saving another skydiver by bringing him a parachute in freefall, firefighting as smoke jumpers, a demo jump before air force officers, incidentially saving one of them from drowning and finally saving some lost children.

name.value: A Game of Insights: For Men Only

item.description: This is a psychological-themed party game for men intended to have competitors explore their feelings, opinions, and awareness on variety of topics and personality areas. The game uses themes drawing from both Eastern and Western traditions of philosophy, etc. The game includes: 78 cards with illustrations, Playing board, Insights Into Action pad, and Guide to Keywords.

Seattleopoly is a Monopoly-style game which uses the theme of the city of Seattle, Washington (USA). Spaces on the gameboard represent well-known attractions, locations, and entities in Seattle. This game comes with: Playing Board, Surprise Cards, Treasure Cards, 2 Dice, Playing pieces, 25 Branch Offices, 15 Skyscrapers, Rules, and Money. The game was produced in connection with Seattle area charities.

"Up and Down" was originally published around 1920 by J.W.Spear & Sons. In 2006 Kosmos reprinted the game, including reproductions of the detailed, painted metal playing figures that were in the original game.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move style game with squares on a circus background.

This is a trivia game with over 1000 questions divided into five categories: Humanity, Earth, History, Technology, and Nature. Players move around the board trying to correctly answer questions so that they can earn chips from each area. The chips are used to surpass obstacles along the way, and players can rearrange the obstacles on the game board. The first player to reach the last square on the board wins.

There are several aspects of the game that make it family-friendly. The first is that questions can be answered in multiple-choice style so that players can try to deduce the answer rather than having to know the fact directly. The second is that there is a catch-up mechanism which boosts the player in last place so that they can compete more effectively.

From the back of the box:

"Imagine strolling down Christmas Tree Lane... Prancing through Reindeer Pass... Gliding down Bobsled Run... Taking a jaunt across Jingle Bell Boulevard. All this and more await you as you journey along the pathway to the North Pole!

Santa has sent his elves into town on last minute errands. Each player must help his elf return to the North Pole, while enjoying holiday activities and collecting gift tokens in his own red gift sack."

This is a roll and move game where the object of the game is to collect the most gift tokens while moving to the end of the board. You have Instructional Spaces (where you complete a task to get tokens), Pictured Spaces (where you get a token), Location Spaces (where you get tokens), and Blank Spaces (where nothing happens). The person who gets the most gift tokens wins the game, and in case of a tie, the person who reached the last space first wins.

Galaxy Xpress is a fun to play abstract card game for age 8+. Player, as the galaxy tour guide, will fly a luxury cruiser and take his tour to three designated planets for sightseeing. If the time is allowed, he will be more than happy to take the tour to sightseeing the natural phenomenon that occurs only once in every one millennium. During the trip, player may take the shortcut through space portal but be most beware of the Xnergy waste and the evil pirate. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory point wins.

Ages 8 and up

Player: 2 to 6

Time: 30 minutes

Contents (98 cards):
12 Planets
4 Events: 1 phenomenon, 2 portals and 1 pirate.
66 Xnergy in 6 colors
6 Tour Schedules
6 Luxury Cruisers
3 Phenomenon Tour Receipts
1 Comet. Starting player card

Creating the Galaxy:
In the middle of the table, randomly place 12 planet cards in a circular clock formation; 1 planet at every hour position. The circular formation is the ‘galaxy’. Then place four event cards next to 12, 3, 6 and 9 o’clock planets; phenomenon next to 12, pirate next to 6, and two portals next to 3 and 9. Event cards must be placed outside of the galaxy.

Goal of the Game:
When one player arrives home after a successful round trip, game continues until the round ends, and player with highest victory points wins.

From The Publisher:

Be the first captain in sail your ship trough the icebergs. A funny game for the whole family

It is a truth universally acknowledged that everybody loves seeing penguins sliding around on the ice. And soccer is the world's game, right? So take some cute families of penguins, give them an icy soccer field and a ball, and watch the slippery goodness that ensues. . .

Penguin Soccer is a game in the tradition of Chess, Checkers and Go. There are no dice, no cards, no random elements - only the skill of the two players. But instead of stern soldiers marching about a battlefield, or abstract stones on a grid, Penguin Soccer is about penguins sliding and spinning and chasing a soccer ball across a frozen field!

Games last up to 45 minutes (or use a chess clock at 15 minutes per player for Tournament-style play).

Originally designed in 2007 as a part of the Looney Pyramids Gaming System, Penguin Soccer was published commercially for the first time in February 2010 and is available direct from NestorGames Worldwide.

Free Android app (AI and multi-player) available from the Google Play Store.
 Online Play


 Super Duper Games
 Jocly

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Kosmopoliya is a Russian board game about space exploration, economy and warfare. The goal of the game is to gain a cosmic monopoly and be the last player on the board.

The game board shows a circle of planets. It is players task to start the economical development on the planets by establishing space ports, mines and factories. Players can do investments on several planets. Players also need to secure their economy by investing into space ships that can protect their convoys. Thus the game is about the balance of maintaining and moving of the their space ship fleet and at the same time developing the economy of planets to get more money. All attacks on planets are solved by throwing dice.

Zvezda game number for Kosmopoliya is 8608.

This is a Monopoly-style game based on the businesses and community landmarks of the town of Yakimg, Washington (USA). Some variations in traditional Monopoly rules are present, including the use of a commodity-futures exchange.

Card game based on the popular SCI-FI show Farscape. The object of the game is to have the highest score by the time the series (game) ends. There are Character cards, event cards, character exit cards and play change cards.
CHARACTERS in the game:
Pa'u Zotoh Zhaan - DelvianPriest 
Aeryn Sun - Ex-PeaceKeeperCommando 
Ka D'Argo - Luxan Warrior 
Chiana - NebariThief 
Dominar Rygel XVI - Hynerian Royalty 
Commander John Crichton - HumanScientist 
Captain Bilar Crais - PeaceKeeper Captain 
Scorpius - PeaceKeeper Special Ops 
SikozuSvalaSugaysiShanu - Kalish Biloid
Pilot - Pilot 
Joolushko Tunay Hovalis - Interion Student 
Utu-Noranti Pralatong - TraskanHerbologist 
Stark - Banik Strykera 
Jothee - Luxan Hybrid 
Moya - Leviathan
Talyn - Leviathan Hybrid 
Lieutenant Braca - PeaceKeeper Officer 
Commandant Mele-On Grayza - PeaceKeeper Officer

Events are drawn from the event deck and have differing effects. When a characters Physical Health or Mental Health has been reduced to zero that character is out of the game. Their are also events that change rules of the game. (reverse direction, reduce hand size, play all cards on a turn not just one, hand size is increased from 5 to 7 and eventually the end of season card which ends the game.)

From Games of Art, Miro is a game based on the artwork of Joan Miró.

The game board consists of a single curved line that loops over itself many times. Players color segments of this line to color in. When an area is enclosed, the player who acted scores points based on the number of enclosing segments he or she owns.

From the publisher: "Angelina can’t wait to be a ballerina
And dance in the big performance! But everything takes time and practice. Before she dances on center stage, she needs To learn her dance steps and collect all the 
necessary items to be a prima Ballerina!"

While learning and performing steps along the way, players try to collect all the items necessary to take ballet classes for the big performance at the Royal Theater. The game features a dual number/color spinner so children who can't count yet can still play.

Monopoly type game designed for Alumni, students and friends of Penn State University, which uses locations, traditions, and features of the university and its athletic programs in place of the traditional Monopoly spaces and cards.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description: A Pittsburgh Steelers Collector's edition of Monopoly, Steeler fans can buy, sell,and trade the blackand gold's greatest players and team assets, including 4 coveted Super Bowls. 6 Collectible Pewter Tokens: Quarterback, Linebacker, football, cheerleader, and a Steeler's helmet and Whistle.

18West is an 18xx design by David G. D. Hecht, published in October 2007 by Deep Thought Games. 18West incorporates a variety of mechanisms into the 18xx framework, including three different types of companies (Granger roads, land grant and public) and subsidized track laying. Mergers are also involved, in which public companies can acquire Granger roads.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
From the Publishers' website
"Scourge! is the first game in our line of Make-Your-Own games. When you receive your book cut it out and assemble it yourself and your ready to play. In the game af Scourge! you take on the role of a cult member bent on taking control after the mysterious death of your leader. Build an army of street thugs and demons and amass a library of spells to defeat your enemies while battling in the crowded alleys of a Victorian Metropolis."

This is an educational children's game intended to teach them fractions. Players compete to correctly identify fractions and fraction calculations while avoiding the "Green Goblin." Game includes a variety of cards with fractions and partial fractions, pie charts, and a green goblin.

The object of B.S. Degree Game is to earn enough college credits (units) to graduate before any other players.

The board is laid out into four quadrants; Freshman, Sophomore, Junior and Senior years.

The playing time is approximately 1-2 hours for two players. Add additional 30-60 minutes for each additional player.

There are also instructions for using other trivia games in conjunction with this one.

Players put words to definitions to advance. Go from home to the library and back. Three different types of cards: Amateur, Intermediate, Expert. Several different definitions per word. 5 playing pieces are provided, and it is suggested that for more players people organize into groups.

At the beginning of the round, 4 cards with different numbers are revealed in a 2x2 pattern.
Each player has five two-faced cards with 4 numbers on each of them, and must use 4 of them to create, as quickly as possible, a 3x3 grid where each number is present once (just like in Sudoku) and the 2x2 pattern of numbers is present as well.
The quickest player wins the round - the winner of the game is the first player to win 3 rounds.

In "Malhação - O Jogo", players are challenged to answer correctly questions about... the other players! Each turn, a player reads out loud a card with a question, and secretly choses one out of three options about how he (or she) would react in such situation. After that, it's time for the others to try to guess which was the chosen answer.

The game always have two winners - each player has a separate score with every other player. In the end, the pair that has the highest sum of points wins the game.

This is a version of the game Monopoly based on the theme of Lionel trains (postwar era). The game has custom money based on vintage Lionel Stock Certificates, Crossing Gate and Banjo Signal Cards, and 6 Collectible Pewter Engine Tokens.
